version_description:
- Improved synchronization with Dragon Medical One when locking and unlocking the iOS device
- Support for usernames including 'space' characters

- Availability in the following marketplaces: United Kingdom, Ireland, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Luxembourg, France, Belgium, Italy, Spain (Spanish and Catalan), and the Netherlands.
- Stability improvements related to microphone synchronization with Dragon Medical One (US/Canada) and Dragon Medical Direct (Europe).
This release provides network and recording stability enhancements.

- Support for iOS 11
- The app no longer exits during recording or when it is being made the active app.
Improved user interface feedback regarding the Record button status on high-latency networks.

- Switch between target applications, such as multiple instances of Dragon Medical One. Local and hosted target applications are presented in the new Target Applications screen featuring machine name and time since last used for quick target identification.
- Switch between multiple saved organization configurations without needing to access configuration links outside the app. Organization profiles are managed in the new Settings screen.
- Added language support for Danish, Finnish and Norwegian.

- The version number has changed to 4.0 to align with Dragon Medical One/Dragon Medical Direct. Going forward, PowerMic Mobile and Dragon Medical One/Dragon Medical Direct will use the same versioning scheme and release cadence.
- The new help screen provides guidance on pairing PowerMic Mobile with the target application. The help content is available from the login, recording and "Target Applications" screens.
- For new users, an overlay on the login screen introduces the help screen.
- Added language support for Swedish and Brazilian Portuguese.
- Stability improvements while recording.
Resolve issue with Help content not displaying.

Deprecated support for iOS versions 8 and 9.0. New minimum supported version is 9.3.5.
This release provides stability enhancements.
Fixed a crash on iOS 13 accessing the Target Applications screen.

This release provides stability enhancements.
Support for iOS versions 9 and 10 is deprecated. The new minimum supported version is iOS 11.

Requires iOS 11 or higher.

Support for Bluetooth headsets and earbuds as well as wired (lightning and 3.5mm) headsets. You can now use the play/pause function of your wired device to control the microphone.

Addressed issues with app switching and device locking requiring users to log in repeatedly.

This release provides stability enhancements.
